message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.RO, cs.SY, cs.CL

The paper presents a novel algorithm for subtask discovery in hierarchical reinforcement learning, which is a topic that spans multiple sub-fields of computer science. However, the use of linearly-solvable Markov decision processes (MDPs) and non-negative matrix factorization (NMF) suggests a focus on machine learning and optimization, specifically in the areas of reinforcement learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and robotics (cs.RO). The paper also discusses the potential applications of the algorithm in natural language processing (cs.CL) and control systems (cs.SY), which further supports these sub-categories.
